author: Madurai Bureau
text:
Special camps for voter enrolment, deletion of names and corrections were held in all the polling booths in the district Saturday.

Collector Sajjansingh R. Chavan inspected the exercise at S.R.M.V. Higher Secondary School at Vadaseri in Nagercoil and the Government High School at Putheri.

He also inspected the 2,137 electronic voting machines (EVMs) and 1440 control units arrived from Buxar district and 860 control units from Behusari district in Bihar on Saturday.

Nagercoil Revenue Divisional Officer S. Madhiyazhagan, Personal Assistant to Collector (Land) S. Natarajan, Agasteeswaram Tahsildar A.V. Murthy, Thovalai Tahsildar L. Muthulakshmi accompanied the Collector.

Thoothukudi

Special camps for inclusion or deletion of names and correction in spelling or change in address was organised as part of summary revision of electoral rolls at 1,559 polling booths in Thoothukudi district on Saturday.

The camps were held in the six Assembly constituencies of Thoothukudi, Kovilpatti, Tiruchendur, Srivaikuntam, Vilathikulam and Ottapidaram. Booth-level officers issued the forms. Officials from Revenue Department, teachers and anganwadi workers were deputed for the work.

During similar camps conducted on January 31, as many as 8,160 forms were submitted by voters for inclusion of names, deletions and making corrections, Collector and District Election Officer M. Ravikumar said.

In Tirunelveli district, special camps were conducted at 2,929 booths in 10 Assembly constituencies. Officials visited select booths and oversaw the proceedings.
title: Special camp for voter enrolment
